title: The cars from the 1920s through the 1970s where much longer and bigger . During the energy crisis, why did the cars look smaller than before? Is it because of Japanese, German imports arrive in North America? - Quora
tags: History of the United States of America

response.answer_text: That plus small cars need smaller engines are lighter and generally get better fuel mileage. A friend of mine started buying GTOs, Chargers, Roadrunners and other muscle cars in good condition for $500 to $1,000 in the early eighties as gas prices and insurance costs went up. He paid ‘$2,200 for a Hemi Charger….

Think about it ! Energy crisis; fuel ten times more expensive than before ! What do you do? You buy a smaller, more economical car, right? Who makes smaller economical cars ? Japan ! There’s your answer ! Gas guzzlers out, European luxury cars in, Japanese runabouts in, your world, and ours, changed !
People tend to downsize their car purchases during fuel shortages because smaller cars get better gas mileage.
